TopicTitle: okay this has been really bugging me...

Articles.Content: how do people get bill jebediah and bob in o.17, it is driving me up a wall
haha, I didn't start with them either for some reason

They should be your very first flight crew zapy97, and will be reused if you return them alive, if they die it'll be a while before they are revived.

You can edit your persistence file to set their state value, 0 is ready for use I think.

Or you could edit the crew value of the pods in the persistence file, the numbers coincide with the crew, with 1,2 and 3 being Jeb, Bill and Bob.
the how do you edit persistance files

First off, back it up, it's in your KSP\saves\YourGameNameHere folder.

It is just plain text so open it with notepad or similar (not wordpad though) and scroll down.

Take a good look, it's pretty basic, Jeb looks like this

CREW

{

name = Jebediah Kerman

brave = 0.5

dumb = 0.5

badS = True

state = 1

ToD = 5943.16767581531

idx = 0

}

{

name = mk1pod

uid = 4294754662

parent = 0

position = 0,0,0

rotation = 0,0,0,1

mirror = 1,1,1

istg = 0

dstg = 0

sqor = 0

sidx = 0

attm = 0

srfN = None, -1

attN = bottom, 2

attN = top, 1

mass = 0.8

temp = -40.48885

expt = 0.5

state = 0

connected = True

attached = True

crew = 1

}

Edited September 24, 2012 by sal_vager
Open the persistence file in notepad. Pretty sure it's JSON from there on out (Or...JSON-like...whatever, close enough.).

First off, back it up, it's in your KSP\saves\YourGameNameHere folder.

It is just plain text so open it with notepad or similar (not wordpad though) and scroll down.

Take a good look, it's pretty basic, Jeb looks like this

CREW

{

name = Jebediah Kerman

brave = 0.5

dumb = 0.5

badS = True

state = 1

ToD = 5943.16767581531

idx = 0

}

{

name = mk1pod

uid = 4294754662

parent = 0

position = 0,0,0

rotation = 0,0,0,1

mirror = 1,1,1

istg = 0

dstg = 0

sqor = 0

sidx = 0

attm = 0

srfN = None, -1

attN = bottom, 2

attN = top, 1

mass = 0.8

temp = -40.48885

expt = 0.5

state = 0

connected = True

attached = True

crew = 1

}

I edit my code files in Notepad++

but why not Wordpad? Are there some weird characters in there or formatting it doesn't support?
Wordpad does not save files in the same way as notepad or notepad++, it'll mangle the file, making it unreadable by KSP.
Is there anyway to apply this method to helping me get all the debris out of my game?
You could write a simple script that found any vessel with "debris" in the value for name, and removed it. A for loop in your language of choice would do the trick.
